newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT - India lower ahead of Reliance, RBI.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT - India lower ahead of Reliance, RBI.

text.p: Indian global depositary receipts (GDRs) ended lower in thin trade ahead of earnings from blue chip Reliance Industries on Friday and an expected cut in the reserve requirements for banks from the central bank.
"The immediate direction depends on how aggressive the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is," said a broker.

The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index JCEAI closed off 0.46 points at 61.13 points, with the premium over the local market at 10.98 percent after the Bombay Stock Exchange 30-share index rose 19.61 points to 3,118.95.
The RBI is expected to announce lower cash reserve ratios for banks on Saturday.
The head of the Bombay Stock Exchange is to meet the country's finance minister to call for measures to boost the BSE, which is down from 3,932 points at the start of the year.
"I do not think the finance ministry will be too attentive, it tends to leave capital markets to sort things out," said the broker.
Indian GDRs are down over 12 percent from the start of 1997.
Earnings from Reliance are expected to be poor, with profit after tax down 26 percent.
Also weighing on the GDR market is a swathe of new issues from overseas telephone monopoly VSNL, Indian Oil and other state companies which want to raise capital.
"That weight of issues will cap any move up in the GDR market," said a trader.

Other Asian markets were little changed with the Capel Korea GDR Index off 0.54 points at 72.76, a premium of 28.67 percent over the local market after the Korea Composite Index fell 13.67 points to close provisionally at 828.61.
The Capel Taiwan GDR Index lost 0.11 point to 90.86, a premium of 2.02 percent after the Taiwan Weighted Index fell 10.03 points to 6,616.38.
